newsitem.title: EGYPT: Germany waives $1 bln of Egypt debt - officials.
newsitem.headline: Germany waives $1 bln of Egypt debt - officials.

text.p: Germany has waived about $1 billion of Egyptian official debt to show international support for the country's economic reform programme, official sources said on Wednesday.

The Paris Club group of creditor nations agreed last week to write off $4 billion in debt, the third and last tranche covered by an agreement dating back to 1991. Germany's $1 billion is part of that tranche.
The officials said the waiver was effective from October 11 and added that it was "an additional and significant contribution to the traditionally close economic cooperation".
The agreement to waive the last tranche had been conditional on approval by the International Monetary Fund of the Egyptian government's economic reform programme.
Finance Minister Mohieddin el-Gharib said last week that the debt waiver would save Egypt about one billion pounds ($290 million) a year in debt servicing.
